page.title: 14ALSTON MOOR'S PAST
page.content: Whitley Castle is a diamond shaped { {Roman fort}and confirms a Roman presence.The Roman road,the Maiden Way,is known to pass through the area but its exact route is in some doubt. Possibly the Romans exploited the { {lead mines}but in the Middle Ages they were known as the Carlisle silver mines and were being worked for lead and silver.The{Earls of Derwentwater} became lords of the manor,but after the Jacobite Rebellion of 1715 the estates were confiscated and granted to the {Greenwich Hospital}for Seamen. In the 19th century Alston was still largely self-sufficient and it was only in the 1820's that McAdam planned the roads which link Alston to nearby towns.These roads can be hazardous in winter conditions and Alston has been completely cut off several times in recent severe winters.
